meta.description: There is more to web development than just syntax; we must understand the nuances of how the internet works, user experience design, and best development practices.

profs-law-of-performance.description: Send less data, less often, from nearby, only when necessary.

html.description: HTML, or HyperText Markup Language is a markup language describing the physical structure of a site. In the analogy of spoken language, HTML corresponds to nouns.

css.description: CSS, or Cascading Style Sheets, allows us to visually style our sites. In the analogy of spoken language, CSS corresponds to adjectives.

javascript.description: JS, or JavaScript, is a scripting language that allows us to add robust interaction to our sites. In the analogy of spoken language, JavaScript corresponds to verbs.

local-storage.description: Store data locally and persistently across sessions in the user's browser.
